### Worked Examples

<h5>Worked Example</h5>
In a certain Metropolitan city the daily consumption of electric power (in Million Kilowatt Hour (MKH)) may be regarded as a random variable having Gamma
distribution with parameter (3,2). 
<p>
If the power plant has a daily capacity of 12 MKH, what is the probability that this power supply will be inadequate on any given day.

### Skewness

<h5> Mode and Skewness: Worked Example</h5>

Consider the following measure of skewness for a unimodal distribution:

\[ S_{KP}  \;=\; \frac{ \mbox{mean} \;-\; \mbox{mode}}{ \mbox{ standard deviation} } \] 

a. Determine the value of ${S_{KP}}$ for a gamma distribution with parameters $ \alpha  = 1.6$ and
$ \lambda  = 0.2$. 
b. Comment on why ${S_{KP}}$  is a suitable measure of skewness for distributions with one mode.

<a href = "https://youtu.be/Ty2i1Mx9GQo">Solution</a>
